title: Treatment, testing, booster shots and more to know
author: CPR
description: What does that mean for Coloradans going about their daily lives? Michelle Barron, senior medical director of infection prevention at UC Health [and professor of medicine at CU School of Medicine], and Sam Dominguez, a pediatric infectious disease doctor at Children's Hospital [and professor of pediatrics at CU School of Medicine] spoke to Colorado Matters about omicron.
sitename: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
cleaned_text: Fueled by the fast-moving omicron variant, Colorado hit a new record for positive COVID-19 cases in a single day — 11,018 on Dec. 31. That was after two days of case numbers above 9,000. CU Anschutz Fitzsimons Building 13001
